title: Task 23

answers.answer: Buying a brand-new camera as soon as possible.
Cleaning the lenses, using a tripod and taking photography courses.
answers.feedback: These may be good recommendations, but Bob doesn't make any of them.

answers.answer: Concentrating on the basic things, learning about the camera you use, and enjoying what you do.
Trying photography and abandoning if you see it's not for you.
answers.feedback: Bob doesn't encourage anyone to quit photography.

dialogue.text: So I always recommend starting with the basics, learning about your camera, and trying to have fun.

description: You say you recommend that someone does something when you tell this person that what you suggest is a good, maybe the best choice for them. For example: I recommend that you read this book. It's the best on the topic. When you have actions following the verb recommend, use them in the -ing form. For example: I recommend reading this book if you want to understand this topic better.
